metadata.title: CVE-2018-10904 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
It was found that glusterfs server does not properly sanitize file paths in the "trusted.io-stats-dump" extended attribute which is used by the "debug/io-stats" translator. Attacker can use this flaw to create files and execute arbitrary code. To exploit this attacker would require sufficient access to modify the extended attributes of files on a gluster volume. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled file paths. An attacker could possibly use this issue to create arbitrary files and execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-10904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterd0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
